poem:
Besieged Silence

In Khan Younis,  
the wind carries whispers—  
stone echoes and shattered dawns.  
A child's shoe, abandoned,  
rests in dust's embrace.  
Horizon burns with  
unspoken grief;  
the sky, a breathless witness.  
Beneath rubble,  
stories silenced,  
an unseen toll,  
waiting to become  
a haunting poem  
of loss.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israeli airstrikes kill at least 72 across Gaza At least 72 people have been killed in Israeli operations across Gaza in the past day, hospital officials in the besieged territory have said, although communication difficulties in the north of the strip mean the final toll could be much higher. In the central town of Khan Younis, 38 people, including at least 13 children from the same family, were killed in airstrikes early on Friday, hospital". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
